Divide the code into groups of 11 without repeating groups. Each group should have a "Copy" button after it.

checklist.title: Is the code grouping requirement accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code correctly divides the provided alphanumeric codes into exactly 11 groups without repeating any group. Each group must be distinct, and the solution should handle the original data which contains duplicates within groups. Deduct 5 points for incorrect grouping logic, 5 points if duplicates are not handled properly, and 5 points if there aren't exactly 11 groups.

checklist.title: Is the 'Copy' button functionality implemented for each group?
checklist.description: Evaluate if each group has a working 'Copy' button that properly copies the content of that specific group to the clipboard. The button should provide visual feedback when clicked. Deduct 5 points if some groups lack copy buttons, 5 points if the buttons don't actually copy the correct content, and 3 points if there's no user feedback after clicking.

checklist.title: Is the HTML structure logically organized for the grouping task?
checklist.description: Check if the HTML structure properly separates the different groups using appropriate semantic elements (like <section>, <article>, or <div> with proper classes). The structure should facilitate CSS styling and JavaScript functionality. Check if the groups are clearly delineated visually. Deduct 5 points for poor semantic structure and 5 points for groups that lack clear visual separation.

checklist.title: Is the clipboard API implementation robust?
checklist.description: Assess whether the clipboard functionality uses modern APIs (navigator.clipboard) with appropriate fallbacks for browser compatibility. The implementation should handle potential permission issues and failures gracefully. Deduct 5 points if no fallback mechanism exists, 5 points if errors aren't handled, and 2 points if no visual feedback is provided for success/failure states.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as empty groups, special characters in codes, and browser clipboard restrictions) and provides friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Group search/filter functionality 2. Sorting options for alphanumeric codes 3. Visual indication of duplicates in original groups). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementations of similar functions (e.g., multiple copy mechanisms) 2. Function modules unrelated to the grouping task (e.g., unnecessary animations) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data processing/UI rendering/user interaction), code reusability, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the solution is overly complex for this straightforward task. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance for the copy buttons. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during interactions, and 5 points for hard-to-find copy buttons. The full score is 10 points.
